Headline: Will 2025 bring a bull run? Key trends for Nifty to watchICICI Securities projects a 20% rise in Nifty for 2025, driven by historical trends, sectoral strength, and strategic stock picks.
Content: ICICI Securities, the domestic brokerage firm, predicts a strong 20% upside for the Nifty50 index in 2025, setting the stage for a bullish year ahead. While the NSE's benchmark index achieved 24,800 in CY24, market volatility in the second half caused a minor correction.Despite this, the brokerage firm is optimistic about the index heading towards 28,800, the upper band of its long-term rising channel.advertisementThe brokerage firm’s analysis highlights that buying near the 52-week EMA historically offers a median return of 23% over the next 12 months. This trend is supported by the breadth indicator, which often finds support in the 30-40 zone during bull markets.Based on these patterns, ICICI Securities forecasts a robust move to 28,800 in 2025, with a crucial support level at 22,000. Despite this, the brokerage firm is optimistic about the index heading towards 28,800, the upper band of its long-term rising channel. The brokerage firm’s analysis highlights that buying near the 52-week EMA historically offers a median return of 23% over the next 12 months. This trend is supported by the breadth indicator, which often finds support in the 30-40 zone during bull markets. Based on these patterns, ICICI Securities forecasts a robust move to 28,800 in 2025, with a crucial support level at 22,000. Past data strengthens the outlook further. On five occasions when FIIs sold equities worth over Rs 30,000 crore in a single quarter, the subsequent 12-month returns averaged 28%. Additionally, markets have delivered double-digit rallies in election years 82% of the time over the last four decades. On the sectoral front, BFSI, capital goods, and IT are expected to outperform, while the PSU and metal sectors present attractive bargain-buy opportunities.TOP STOCK PICKS FOR 2025 ICICI Securities has identified eight stocks with strong potential for the next 12 months. They are United Spirits (Target: Rs1,820), Indian Bank (Target: Rs705), Steel Authority of India (Target: Rs153), Timken India (Target: Rs2,750), CESC (Target: Rs235), BEML (Target: Rs5,390), JK Lakshmi Cement (Target: Rs994) and Rallis India (Target: Rs375). With historical trends, technical indicators, and sectoral strength aligning, 2025 appears poised for a significant Nifty50 rally. For investors, this could be the perfect time to capitalise on market opportunities and position portfolios for growth.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Rama Mohan Rao Amara appointed as SBI's new managing director: ReportThe decision was made by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC), which is headed by the Prime Minister.
Content: Rama Mohan Rao Amara has been appointed as the new Managing Director (MD) of State Bank of India (SBI), reported news agency Reuters. Amara’s appointment has been approved for a period of three years. The decision was made by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC), which is headed by the Prime Minister. This appointment comes after Amara was recommended for the role by the Financial Services Institutions Bureau (FSIB), the official headhunter for directors in state-owned banks and institutions, earlier in September. Amara will take over the position vacated by CS Setty, the outgoing MD of SBI. This appointment fills the key vacancy in SBI's leadership team, which includes the Chairman and four Managing Directors who oversee the bank's vast operations. The FSIB had interviewed nine candidates for the role of SBI Managing Director. “Keeping in view their performance in the interface, overall experience and the extant parameters, the Bureau recommends Rama Mohan Rao Amara for the position of MD in SBI," the FSIB said in a statement earlier.  The selection process was based on a combination of factors, including the candidates’ experience, qualifications, and suitability for the role. Rama Mohan Rao Amara is a seasoned banker with extensive experience in various roles within SBI. Although specific details about his career background were not provided in the report, appointments to such senior positions usually consider years of experience in banking, leadership skills, and familiarity with SBI’s operations. Amara’s appointment adds to the leadership team of the country’s largest bank, which plays a critical role in driving India’s banking sector and supporting government financial initiatives.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Own foreign assets or income? Disclose now to avoid Rs 10 lakh penaltyTaxpayers must disclose foreign income and assets by December 31, 2024, to avoid hefty penalties under the Income Tax and Black Money Acts.
Content:
Failing to disclose foreign income and assets can land taxpayers in double trouble under both the Income Tax Act and the Black Money Act. To address widespread confusion, the Income Tax Department has released a detailed brochure on December 11, 2024, to help taxpayers navigate their disclosure obligations. With penalties and prosecution on the line, timely compliance is essential.advertisementWHO NEEDS TO REPORT AND WHAT TO DISCLOSE?All Indian residents with foreign income or assets must report them in their Income Tax Returns (ITR). This includes:
Foreign bank accounts, equity, debt interests, business interests, immovable property, and other assets.
Foreign income such as interest, dividends, capital gains, and other earnings.
The applicable schedules for reporting are Schedule FA (foreign assets), Schedule FSI (foreign income), and Schedule TR (tax relief). It must be noted that ITR-1 and ITR-4 forms cannot be used for these disclosures.STEPS FOR FILING AND DEADLINES All Indian residents with foreign income or assets must report them in their Income Tax Returns (ITR). This includes:
Foreign bank accounts, equity, debt interests, business interests, immovable property, and other assets.
Foreign income such as interest, dividends, capital gains, and other earnings.
 The applicable schedules for reporting are Schedule FA (foreign assets), Schedule FSI (foreign income), and Schedule TR (tax relief). It must be noted that ITR-1 and ITR-4 forms cannot be used for these disclosures.STEPS FOR FILING AND DEADLINES Taxpayers must declare foreign income and assets in the applicable ITR for the assessment year they were a resident in India. The deadlines are as follows: Original returns: File by July 31, 2024. Belated or revised returns: File by December 31, 2024. If a return has already been filed without these disclosures, taxpayers can revise their ITR using the correct form and schedules before the December deadline. Accurate documentation, such as acquisition details and income generated, is critical.CONSEQUENCES OF NON-DISCLOSURE Non-compliance can result in penalties of up to Rs 10 lakh if foreign assets exceed Rs 20 lakh (excluding immovable property). Further, prosecution under the Black Money Act could be initiated for false or incomplete disclosures. Late filers have until December 31, 2024, to submit belated or revised returns to avoid legal repercussions. Disclosing foreign income and assets not only ensures compliance with Indian tax laws but also avoids double taxation under international agreements. The Income Tax Department has simplified the process through a brochure that explains the steps to disclose and claim relief. Taxpayers should take this opportunity to file accurate returns and align with both the Income Tax Act and the Black Money Act. With heavy penalties and legal actions looming, timely disclosure isn’t just advisable—it’s indispensable for financial integrity.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 18, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty stumble: Will 2024 end with stock markets in red?Sensex, Nifty stumble: The market has been under pressure for three consecutive days, with the Sensex losing 1,951 points during this period.
Content: The end of the year is usually a time for celebrations, with the festive spirit of Christmas and the promise of a fresh start on New Year’s Eve. But on Dalal Street, the mood seems more 'bearish' with the bears taking control than holiday cheer. Instead of ringing in gains, the markets are grappling with losses, leaving investors questioning whether 2024 will wrap up in the red. Dalal Street has faced a rough patch over the past few trading sessions. The benchmark indices, the S&P BSE Sensex and the NSE Nifty50, extended their losses today, leaving investors worried about their year-end performance. The Sensex dropped by 502.25 points to close at 80,182.20, while the Nifty50 declined by 137.15 points to settle at 24,198.85. Financial and banking heavyweights were among the major losers, dragging the indices down further. "The Indian market is experiencing a breakdown in the early Santa Claus rally, with the impact being more pronounced in India compared to developed markets due to the rapid appreciation of the dollar. Market sentiment remains cautious ahead of the FOMC meeting and potential policy and tariff shifts from the incoming US administration," said Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services.INVESTORS’ WEALTH TAKES A HIT The market has been under pressure for three consecutive days, with the Sensex losing 1,951 points during this period. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms has shrunk significantly, falling from Rs 459 lakh crore on December 13 to Rs 453 lakh crore today, marking a loss of Rs 6 lakh crore in just three sessions. Ajit Mishra, SVP of Research at Religare Broking Ltd, said, “Foreign fund outflows and caution ahead of the US Federal Reserve’s policy decision have kept investors on edge. Banking, metals, and energy sectors have been the top losers, while the broader indices have also seen selling pressure, ending lower by 0.6% to 0.9%.”WILL THE MARKETS END THE YEAR IN RED? The recent slump has raised questions about whether the markets will close the year in negative territory.  VLA Ambala, Sebi Registered Research Analyst and Co-Founder of Stock Market Today, said, “The current major support level for the market is at 23,000, while we are trading at 24,200. If the price fails to hold this range, participants may see further bearishness. Additional factors, such as the weakening of the Indian rupee against the US dollar, could also contribute to market volatility.” Ambala added that market participants are closely monitoring the US Federal Reserve’s policy decision. “Signals from the Fed, whether hawkish or dovish, will play a significant role in determining market direction. A dovish stance could lift sentiment and potentially lead to a strong rebound, while a hawkish stance could further weigh on the markets,” she said. Satish Chandra Aluri from Lemonn Markets Desk also pointed out that the Fed’s Summary of Economic Projections and Chair Jerome Powell’s press conference could provide crucial insights into interest rate decisions for 2025. “Markets are pricing in a pause in January and expecting a cumulative rate cut of around 50 basis points in 2025. Any surprises could either lift or drag markets further,” he explained.OUTLOOK FOR 2025 Despite the current downturn, there is optimism for 2025. ICICI Securities predicts a strong upside for the Nifty50 index, with potential gains of up to 20% in the coming year. The brokerage firm believes the Nifty could climb to 28,800, marking the upper range of a long-term rising channel. “Buying near the 52-week EMA (exponential moving average) has historically offered favourable returns, with a median gain of 23% over the next 12 months,” said ICICI Securities. The brokerage also highlighted historical trends, noting that on five occasions when foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold over Rs 30,000 crore worth of equities in a single quarter, the average one-year forward return was 28%. Additionally, markets have seen a double-digit rally in election years 82% of the time over the past four decades. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty end lower as US trade and Fed jitters spook investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 502.25 points to end at 80,182.20, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 137.15 points to close the day at 24,198.85.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed lower on Wednesday dragged by a decline in heavyweight financials and banking stocks, extending their losses.  The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 502.25 points to end at 80,182.20, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 137.15 points to close the day at 24,198.85.  Vaibhav Vidwani, Research Analyst, Bonanza said that the selling pressure was exacerbated by concerns over potential trade tensions following US President-elect Donald Trump's remarks about imposing tariffs on India. "Additionally, market sentiment remained cautious ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve's interest rate decision later in the day, with investors wary of a possible slowdown in rate cuts that could impact global liquidity. Sector-wise, financials, power, and auto stocks were among the hardest hit, reflecting broader market apprehensions as traders await clearer signals from global economic indicators," he added.  Even in a generally subdued market environment, companies making their stock market debut saw impressive listing gains today. Online payments company Mobikwik led the way with a surge of over 89.25%, while budget retailer Vishal Mega Mart climbed 43.5%. Drugmaker Sai Life Sciences also performed well, ending its first trading day with a 39.3% gain. "Markets are in cautious mode ahead of US Fed meeting as investors look forward to the Fed’s Summary of Economic Projections and Chair Powell’s press conference, which may indicate how aggressive it will be in cutting rates in 2025. Markets are already discounting a pause in January meeting and are pricing in only a cumulative cut of about 50bps in 2025, much lower than 100bps priced just couple of months back. Any dovish signal from Powell will lift the sentiment given the bearish positioning in the markets and may lead to a strong rebound throughout the rest of the year. On the other hand, hawkish signals may trigger further downside in the markets," said Satish Chandra Aluri, Lemonn Markets Desk. "The stock market is under pressure due to slower GDP growth, high inflation, low employment rates, and challenges from global trade and banking policies. According to the market analysis, Nifty can expect support around 24200 and 24000, while resistance near 24305 and 24430 in the next session.” said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Va Tech Wabag shares: Why VA Tech Wabag stocks are in focus?As of 2:50 PM, the shares were trading at Rs 1,655.15, down 12.20% from the previous close. Earlier in the day, the stock dropped to Rs 1,586.50 on the NSE, marking a 15.8% decline.
Content: Shares of water treatment firm Va Tech Wabag were in the spotlight on Monday, December 18, following a sharp fall in the stock price. The shares plunged over 16% in the morning trade after the company announced the cancellation of a major tender it had secured earlier this year for a 300 million litre per day (MLD) seawater desalination plant in Saudi Arabia. As of 2:50 PM, the shares were trading at Rs 1,655.15, down 12.20% from the previous close. Earlier in the day, the stock dropped to Rs 1,586.50 on the NSE, marking a 15.8% decline. This steep fall wiped out a huge portion of the company’s recent market gains. Over the past year, Va Tech Wabag shares had surged by over 193%, outperforming the NSE Nifty 50 index, which gained 14% during the same period. However, the latest development has dented investor confidence, resulting in heavy selling pressure.REASON FOR THE DECLINE The sharp fall in Va Tech Wabag shares followed the company’s announcement that the Saudi Water Authority had cancelled the tender for the Rs 2,700 crore desalination project. This project, awarded to the company in September, was a major contract on an engineering, procurement, construction, and commissioning (EPCC) basis. The company said that the cancellation was due to "internal administrative procedures" within the Saudi Water Authority. Va Tech Wabag is currently in discussions with the authority to understand the reasons behind the decision. The now-cancelled project was a 300 MLD mega seawater reverse osmosis desalination plant in Yanbu, Saudi Arabia. It was expected to be completed within 30 months and was designed to incorporate state-of-the-art desalination technologies for energy efficiency and compliance with Saudi Arabia’s environmental regulations. Va Tech Wabag had described the project as a significant milestone, highlighting its expertise in desalination technology and its long-standing presence in Saudi Arabia. The company has been active in the region for over four decades, constructing and operating water and wastewater treatment plants. Globally, since 1995, Va Tech Wabag has built over 60 desalination plants across 17 countries, catering to both municipal and industrial clients. The cancellation of the project has raised concerns about the company’s growth prospects, given the size and importance of the order. The Rs 2,700 crore project was seen as a key driver of Va Tech Wabag’s revenue in the coming years.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: NMDC share price falls over 6% today. Here's whyShares of NMDC and steel firms fell as Karnataka proposed a mining tax bill, impacting iron ore costs and profitability across the sector.
Content: Shares of NMDC Ltd. and other steel companies came under pressure on December 18 following the Karnataka government’s proposal to tax mines and mining land, reported by CNBC. National Mineral Development Corporation Limited bore the brunt of the sell-off, with shares dropping 6% to Rs 213.49 apiece by 12:30 pm, marking its steepest fall in 18 weeks. Other steel stocks, including JSW Steel and SAIL, also saw declines of 2% and 1.74%, respectively, as reports suggested a possible hike in duties on iron ore.advertisementKARNATAKA’S MINING TAX BILL AND ITS IMPLICATIONSThe Karnataka Cabinet recently approved the Karnataka (Mineral Rights and Mineral Bearing Land) Tax Bill, 2024, aimed at levying taxes on mineral rights and mineral-bearing land. This decision is particularly significant for NMDC, as Karnataka accounts for 35% of its production. The Karnataka Cabinet recently approved the Karnataka (Mineral Rights and Mineral Bearing Land) Tax Bill, 2024, aimed at levying taxes on mineral rights and mineral-bearing land. This decision is particularly significant for NMDC, as Karnataka accounts for 35% of its production. The proposed Bill allows for taxes ranging between Rs 20 and Rs 100 per tonne of minerals, which could generate annual revenue of Rs 4,207.95 crore for the state. Additionally, land-bearing mineral taxes are expected to add another Rs 505.9 crore annually. The Bill comes after the Supreme Court's earlier approval for states to retrospectively collect mining taxes from 2005. Higher iron ore costs resulting from the tax are likely to affect the profitability of steelmakers and miners alike. As Karnataka’s proposed mining tax reshapes the cost structure for steel and mining companies, stakeholders and investors will closely monitor its implementation and broader implications for the sector.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Rs 880 crore unclaimed: Is your LIC policy among them? Here's how to checkOver Rs 880 crore in LIC maturity benefits remain unclaimed by nearly 3.72 lakh policyholders in FY24.
Content: A surprising revelation from the Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) has brought attention to unclaimed maturity benefits worth â‚¹880.93 crore for the financial year 2023–24. According to Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary, who shared the data in Parliament, around 3.72 lakh policyholders failed to collect their maturity benefits during this period, reports PTI. If you think you might have missed out, here’s how you can check and claim your unclaimed LIC policy amount.advertisementHOW TO CHECK UNCLAIMED LIC AMOUNTSPolicyholders or beneficiaries can check unclaimed amounts by visiting the LIC website (https://licindia.in/home). Here are the steps: Policyholders or beneficiaries can check unclaimed amounts by visiting the LIC website (https://licindia.in/home). Here are the steps: Go to the 'Customer Service' section and select 'Unclaimed Amounts of Policy Holders.' Enter the policy number, name, date of birth, and PAN card details. Click on ‘Submit’ to view the details   Required details include the policyholder's name, policy number, date of birth, and PAN. LIC has also implemented various measures, including media campaigns and regular follow-ups by agents, to reduce unclaimed claims.WHAT HAPPENS TO LONG-UNCLAIMED AMOUNTS? If money remains unclaimed for over 10 years, it is transferred to the Senior Citizen Welfare Fund (SCWF). These funds are utilised for senior citizens' welfare. The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) mandates insurers to display unclaimed amounts of Rs 1,000 or more on their websites. Unclaimed amounts can arise due to litigation, rival claims, blocked policies, or policyholders being out of reach, such as residing abroad or delaying claims for pensions or annuities. Unclaimed deposits are more than forgotten amounts; they reflect missed opportunities for financial security. LIC’s efforts to streamline settlements and spread awareness aim to ensure rightful policyholders or beneficiaries receive their dues promptly. Checking your policy status regularly can save you from losing out on valuable benefits. Don't let your hard-earned money sit idle—claim it while it’s still yours!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 18, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Stock market crash: 3 reasons why Sensex, Nifty are under pressure todayThe S&P BSE Sensex declined by 612.55 points, or 0.76%, to 80,071.90, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 179.55 points, or 0.74%, to 24,156.45 as of 12:50 PM.
Content: The Sensex and Nifty continued their downward slide for the third consecutive session on Wednesday, as global and domestic factors weighed heavily on investor sentiment. The benchmark indices fell ahead of the US Federal Reserve's policy announcement later today, with market participants closely watching for hints on future interest rate moves. The S&P BSE Sensex declined by 612.55 points, or 0.76%, to 80,071.90, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 179.55 points, or 0.74%, to 24,156.45 as of 12:50 PM. Volatility remained high, with the India VIX fear gauge inching up by 0.20% to 14.52. Investor wealth, as reflected by the total market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, fell by Rs 1.35 lakh crore to Rs 453.78 lakh crore.advertisementKEY REASONS BEHIND THE FALLGlobal pressure ahead of Fed decision - Global markets are on edge ahead of the outcome of the US Federal Reserve's two-day meeting. While the Fed is widely expected to cut interest rates by 25 basis points, uncertainty looms over its future policy stance. Analysts at Nomura noted that the Fed's post-meeting commentary is likely to be hawkish, with projections suggesting a slower pace of rate cuts in 2025 and an increase in the long-term median rate to 3%. Global pressure ahead of Fed decision - Global markets are on edge ahead of the outcome of the US Federal Reserve's two-day meeting. While the Fed is widely expected to cut interest rates by 25 basis points, uncertainty looms over its future policy stance. Analysts at Nomura noted that the Fed's post-meeting commentary is likely to be hawkish, with projections suggesting a slower pace of rate cuts in 2025 and an increase in the long-term median rate to 3%. Adding to the jitters, the US Dow Jones Industrial Average fell for the ninth straight session on Tuesday, marking its longest losing streak since February 1978. Rising US Treasury yields and continued strength in the US dollar are also dampening market sentiment globally. Banking stocks plunge - Private banking stocks led the decline as markets tanked on Wednesday. Heavyweights like HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, and Axis Bank together dragged the Sensex down by over 250 points. Other major losers included Power Grid, which fell 2.23% to Rs 322.65, and Tata Motors, NTPC, and Bharti Airtel, which declined by up to 1.9%. Record low rupee and FPI outflows - The rupee hit a record low against the US dollar, driven by rising US interest rates and global currency market dynamics. A weaker rupee often triggers foreign portfolio investor (FPI) outflows, and data shows that FPIs sold Indian equities worth Rs 6,409.86 crore on Wednesday alone. "The external pressure on the rupee is becoming more intense due to high US interest rates, idiosyncratic euro weakness, and tariff risks for the yuan," HSBC said. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, highlighted that foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have turned sellers during market rallies, contributing to the downward pressure. He pointed out that the trend of FII buying seen earlier in December was short-lived, as FIIs are now favouring the US market, which has outperformed India. Despite the weakness in the benchmarks, the broader market has shown resilience. Vijayakumar said that stocks delivering strong quarterly results are being rewarded, and there is less concern about FII selling in this segment. On a year-to-date basis, the S&P 500 in the US has gained 27.5%, outperforming the Nifty, which has risen only 12%. This divergence in performance is causing concern among investors, with fears that the trend may continue unless Indian economic indicators show a recovery in GDP growth and corporate earnings in the upcoming quarter.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Explained: Why Enviro Infra share price fell 10% in early trade today The decline in Enviro Infra's share price comes on the same day the company is set to announce its financial performance for the quarter ended September 30, 2024.
Content: Shares of Enviro Infra Engineers Ltd. dropped nearly 10% in early trading on Wednesday, following a revision in the trading circuit limit from 20% to 10% on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The decline in Enviro Infra's share price comes on the same day the company is set to announce its financial performance for the quarter ended September 30, 2024. The share price hit an intraday low of Rs 342.53 per share before recovering slightly to trade 9.22% lower at Rs 345.49 by 10:26 AM.  Despite today’s fall, Enviro Infra shares have delivered strong returns in 2024, rising 67.21% year-to-date. Enviro Infra's stock has witnessed high trading activity since its recent listing in November 2024. The stock surged by 33% in just a few days, reaching a fresh high of Rs 392.00 on Tuesday. The impressive rally followed a multibagger performance since its debut at Rs 218 on the BSE, higher than the IPO price of Rs 148. From its IPO price, the stock has delivered a remarkable return of nearly 164%. The initial public offering (IPO) of Enviro Infra Engineers received strong response, with an oversubscription of 89.9 times. T The IPO, which closed on November 26, consisted of a fresh issue of 3.87 crore equity shares and an offer-for-sale of 52.68 lakh shares by the promoters. At the upper price band, the IPO was valued at Rs 650.43 crore. According to the company’s pre-IPO documents, Enviro Infra’s total income for the nine-month period ending December 31, 2023, was Rs 4,285 crore. In fiscal 2023, the company reported revenue of Rs 3,381 crore, a significant jump from Rs 2,235 crore in the previous year. Profitability has also improved, with the company reporting a profit of Rs 550 crore in fiscal 2023, compared to Rs 345 crore in fiscal 2022. However, it is worth noting that Enviro Infra had posted a loss of Rs 86 crore in fiscal 2021, highlighting the company’s recovery and growth trajectory. Enviro Infra Engineers is primarily engaged in designing, building, operating, and maintaining water and wastewater treatment plants. The company focuses on zero-liquid discharge-compliant treatment processes, ensuring treated water can be reused for purposes such as horticulture, washing, refrigeration, and industrial processes. Over the past seven years, Enviro Infra has completed 26 wastewater treatment and water and sanitation projects across India. These include 20 large-scale projects with a capacity of 10 MLD (million litres per day) or more. The company plans to use the IPO proceeds for working capital needs, investments in a 60 MLD sewage treatment plant (STP) project in Mathura, Uttar Pradesh, debt repayment, and general corporate purposes.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Mobikwik shares make bumper debut: Should you book profit? Mobikwik share price: The stock of Mobikwik opened on the BSE at Rs 442.25, listing at a premium of 58.51% over the issue price of Rs 279.
Content: Mobikwik shares made an impressive debut on the stock exchanges on Wednesday, listing at a premium of over 50%.  The shares of Mobikwik opened on the BSE at Rs 442.25, listing at a premium of 58.51% over the issue price of Rs 279. On the NSE, the stock began trading at Rs 440, reflecting a 57.71% premium. The Mobikwik IPO was oversubscribed 119.38 times in total, with retail investors leading the way by subscribing 134.67 times. The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) category saw a subscription of 119.50 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) segment was subscribed 108.95 times. The allotment of shares for Mobikwik Systems' initial public offering (IPO) was finalised on Monday after receiving strong interest from investors. The IPO, which concluded on December 13, 2024, was one of three that were open for bidding last week but stood out with the highest number of subscriptions.SHOULD YOU BOOK PROFIT? Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart Ltd, said that the company’s recent move towards profitability and the increasing adoption of digital payments have bolstered market confidence. "However, sustaining this momentum would depend on its ability to maintain profitability and carve out a niche in the competitive fintech sector. Investors are recommended to book profits given the high listing gains, while those wanting to hold should set a stop loss at around Rs 400," she added. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Sai Life Sciences shares debut at 18% premium on stock exchanges Sai Life Sciences share price today: Sai Life Sciences shares made a strong debut on Wednesday, listing at a premium of 18% on the NSE, with the stock opening at Rs 650, which is Rs 101 above its issue price.
Content: Shares of Sai Life Sciences made a decent market debut as the stocks listed at a premium of over 18% on the Dalal Street on Wedneday.  Sai Life Sciences shares made a strong debut on Wednesday, listing at a premium of 18% on the NSE, with the stock opening at Rs 650, which is Rs 101 above its issue price. On the BSE, the shares were listed at Rs 641.1, reflecting a 16.8% premium or an increase of Rs 92.1 from the issue price. The IPO was subscribed 10.27 times, showing decent investor interest despite concerns about its overvaluation and high OFS proportion.  "While the company’s positive financial performance and rising profitability are encouraging, the limited direct benefits from the IPO proceeds may lead to cautious investor sentiment in the long term. It is advisable to book profits at this level, but for those wishing to hold, a stop loss at around Rs 585," said Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart Ltd. Allotment of shares for the initial public offering (IPO) of Sai Life Sciences Limited was finalised on Monday after the 3-day bidding process concluded on December 13, 2024. The initial public offering (IPO) of Sai Life Sciences received strong investor interest, with an overall subscription of 10.27 times. Among the different investor categories, the retail segment was subscribed 1.39 times, while the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category saw the highest enthusiasm, with subscriptions reaching 29.78 times. Non-Institutional Investors (NII), which include high-net-worth individuals, subscribed to the issue 4.99 times.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Bumper debut for Mobikwik shares as stocks list at 59% premium on Dalal StreetMobikwik share price: The shares of One Mobikwik Systems debuted on the BSE at Rs 442.25, marking a 58.51% premium over the issue price of Rs 279.
Content: Mobikwik shares made a bumper debut on the stock exchanges on Wednesday, listing at a premium of over 50%, making investors richer.  The shares of One Mobikwik Systems debuted on the BSE at Rs 442.25, marking a 58.51% premium over the issue price of Rs 279. On the NSE, the stock began trading at Rs 440, reflecting a 57.71% premium compared to the issue price. The allotment of shares for the initial public offering (IPO) of Mobikwik Systems Limited was finalised on Monday after having witnessed strong interest from investors. Mobikwik IPO was among the three IPOs that were open for bidding in the last week but received the most subscriptions. Mobikwik IPO bidding closed on December 13, 2024. Mobikwik IPO saw an overall subscription of 119.38 times. Retail investors led the bidding process and the section was subscribed 134.67 times. Qualified Institutional Buyers(QIBs) section was subscribed 119.50 times, while Non Institutional Investors (NII) section received a bid of 108.95 times. "The company’s recent shift to profitability, coupled with the growing adoption of digital payments, boosted market confidence. However, sustaining this momentum would depend on its ability to maintain profitability and carve out a niche in the competitive fintech sector. Investors are recommended to book profits given the high listing gains, while those wanting to hold should set a stop loss at around Rs 400," said Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart Ltd.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Vishal Mega Mart shares make strong market debut at 33% premium on D-Street Vishal Mega Mart share price: The stock began trading at Rs 104, at a premium of 33% over its issue price of Rs 78.
Content: Vishal Mega Mart shares made a bumper debut on the Dalal Street on Wednesday after the shares listed at a premium of over 33%.  Vishal Mega Mart made an impressive debut on the NSE, surpassing market expectations by listing at a 33.33% premium to its IPO allotment price of Rs 78. The stock began trading at Rs 104, providing substantial returns for those who invested during the IPO. Following the strong opening, the Gurugram-based retail giant's market capitalisation climbed to Rs 46,891 crore. The allotment for shares was completed on December 16, 2024 after it garnered a good response from the investors, having been subscribed over 27 times after the 3-day bidding process which started on December 11. The company offered shares in the price band of Rs 74-78 per share, with a minimum lot size of 190 shares. Established in 2001, Vishal Mega Mart is a prominent hypermarket chain in India, offering a wide variety of products. These include apparel, groceries, electronics, home essentials, and fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG). The company markets both its own private labels and products from well-known third-party brands, catering to diverse consumer demands. "Given that this was a complete offer for sale (OFS), there are no direct benefits to the company, making it a play purely on market sentiment and its growth story in the retail sector. Investors are advised to book profits at this level, while those looking to hold should maintain a stop loss at around Rs 95," said Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart Ltd.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower as cautious investors weigh global trendsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 15.56 points to 80,668.89, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4 points to 24,332.00.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened lower on Wednesday after having incurred heavy losses in the past two trading sessions as cautious sentiment prevailed among investors.  The S&P BSE Sensex was down 15.56 points to 80,668.89, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4 points to 24,332.00 as of 9:55 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the near-term market construct has turned weak with FIIs turning sellers on rallies. "The trend of FII buying in early December has proved to be, as feared, a flash in the pan. Yesterday’s massive FII sell figure of Rs 6410 crores in the cash market indicates that more selling is in store on market bounces. The underlying reason for the FII selling in India is the outperformance of US and the underperformance of India. While the S&P 500 is up 27.5% YTD, Nifty is up only 12% YTD. The fear is that this huge variation in relative performances may continue, given the strength of the US economy and the weakness in the Indian economy. The situation will change if leading indicators in India suggest recovery in GDP growth and corporate earnings in Q3," he added.  Global markets are closely watching the Federal Reserve's decision, which is anticipated later today. The market has already factored in a 25 basis point rate cut, making the central point of interest the Fed's commentary accompanying the decision. Meanwhile, in the Indian market, a notable trend is emerging where the broader market is showing strong performance. Companies delivering positive results are being rewarded by investors, and foreign institutional investor (FII) selling does not appear to be a significant concern at the moment. Most sectoral indices opened in red.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 18, 2024

Headline: Facebook owner Meta hit with 251 million euros in fines for 2018 data breachIreland's Data Protection Commission issued the penalties to Meta after wrapping up its inquiry into the breach, when hackers gained access to user accounts by exploiting bugs in the platform's code.
Content: European Union privacy watchdogs hit Facebook owner Meta with fines totaling 251 million euros on Monday after an investigation into a 2018 data breach on the social media platform that exposed millions of accounts. Ireland's Data Protection Commission issued the penalties after wrapping up its inquiry into the breach, when hackers gained access to user accounts by exploiting bugs in the platform's code that allowed them to steal digital keys, known as "access tokens". Under the 27-nation EU's strict privacy regime, the Irish watchdog is Meta's lead privacy regulator because the company's regional headquarters are based in Dublin. The watchdog issued reprimands and "administrative penalties" worth 251 million euros ($264 million) after it found multiple infringements of the rules, known as the General Data Protection Regulation. The company said it would appeal the decision. "This decision relates to an incident from 2018. We took immediate action to fix the problem as soon as it was identified," Meta said in a statement. The company said it "proactively informed people impacted" as well as the Irish watchdog. When it first disclosed the problem, Facebook said 50 million user accounts were affected. But the actual number was around 29 million, including 3 million in Europe, the Irish watchdog said on Tuesday. The company has said that after discovering the bug, it alerted the FBI and regulators in the US and Europe. The hack involved three distinct bugs in Facebook's "View As" feature, which let people see how their profiles appear to others. The attackers used the vulnerability to steal access tokens from the accounts of people whose profiles came up in searches using the "View As" feature. The attack then moved from one user's Facebook friend to another. Possession of those tokens would allow attackers to control those accounts.Published By: Sahil SinhaPublished On: Dec 17, 2024

Headline: Cryptocurrencies to be taxed as capital gains: Relief for pre-FY23 earningsThe Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) decision defines cryptocurrencies as capital assets, distinguishing pre-2022 profits as capital gains and applying a 30% flat tax to post-2022 transactions.
Content: The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) in Jodhpur has clarified how cryptocurrency profits should be taxed in its ruling in Tuesday.  It ruled that cryptocurrencies, like Bitcoin and Ethereum, are capital assets, meaning profits from their sale are to be treated as capital gains instead of income from other sources. This decision applies to transactions made before April 1, 2022, when the government introduced specific cryptocurrency tax rules.advertisementTAXATION BEFORE AND AFTER 2022Pre-2022 transactions: Before the Virtual Digital Assets (VDA) regulations came into effect in 2022, profits from crypto sales were categorised as capital gains, much like profits from stocks or real estate. Investors holding cryptocurrencies for more than three years could classify their gains as long-term capital gains, often resulting in lower taxes. The ITAT’s ruling confirms this treatment and provides clarity for those who sold cryptocurrencies during this period. Pre-2022 transactions: Before the Virtual Digital Assets (VDA) regulations came into effect in 2022, profits from crypto sales were categorised as capital gains, much like profits from stocks or real estate. Investors holding cryptocurrencies for more than three years could classify their gains as long-term capital gains, often resulting in lower taxes. The ITAT’s ruling confirms this treatment and provides clarity for those who sold cryptocurrencies during this period. Post-2022 transactions: Starting April 1, 2022, the government imposed a flat 30% tax on all cryptocurrency profits, regardless of the holding period. Unlike earlier rules, no deductions or exemptions are allowed under this regime. Whether you hold your crypto for a few months or several years, the same tax rate applies.WHAT THIS MEANS FOR CRYPTO INVESTORS The ITAT ruling offers clarity and a fair approach for crypto investors: Profits before 2022: Must be reported as capital gains. Long-term holdings (over three years) qualify for reduced tax rates under long-term capital gains rules. Profits after 2022: Will be taxed at a fixed rate of 30%, with no deductions. Sandeep Jhunjhunwala, a tax expert, highlighted that this ruling not only recognises cryptocurrencies as capital assets but also provides much-needed clarity for transactions before 2022. Investors must maintain detailed records of all transactions, including purchase and sale dates, and profit calculations, to meet tax compliance requirements. This decision simplifies cryptocurrency taxation and ensures investors treat their profits correctly based on when the transactions occurred.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 17, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Income Tax Department admits error of sending wrong ITR notices. Check details The Income Tax Department has acknowledged its mistake in sending defective ITR notices, offering relief to many, though taxpayers who filed revised returns could face complications.
Content: In an unexpected move, the Income Tax Department has acknowledged its error in sending defective ITR notices to taxpayers who had correctly filed their returns. While this admission has brought relief to many, it also raises questions about the reliability of such notices. Some taxpayers, in their haste to comply, filed revised ITRs, potentially complicating their situation.advertisementWHAT WENT WRONG WITH THE NOTICES?On November 29, 2024, the tax department issued notices citing defective ITRs under Section 44AD, claiming discrepancies in turnover limits and missing financial documents.However, on December 5, 2024, the department clarified the mistake, stating, “A defective return notice was wrongly issued on 29th Nov 2024 stating that income is offered u/s 44AD, even though the gross receipts are more than Rs 2 crore and the balance sheet and profit and loss account have not been filed, and books of accounts are not audited. Kindly ignore the communication in this regard. We regret the above erroneous communication, which was issued, for the return filed for the AY 2024-25. This return is now being taken up for processing. Please await the receipt of intimation for the results of processing." On November 29, 2024, the tax department issued notices citing defective ITRs under Section 44AD, claiming discrepancies in turnover limits and missing financial documents. However, on December 5, 2024, the department clarified the mistake, stating, “A defective return notice was wrongly issued on 29th Nov 2024 stating that income is offered u/s 44AD, even though the gross receipts are more than Rs 2 crore and the balance sheet and profit and loss account have not been filed, and books of accounts are not audited. Kindly ignore the communication in this regard. We regret the above erroneous communication, which was issued, for the return filed for the AY 2024-25. This return is now being taken up for processing. Please await the receipt of intimation for the results of processing." Experts welcomed this rare acknowledgement. Chartered Accountant Ashish Niraj, while speaking to The Economic Times, explained that Section 44AD allows small businesses with turnover up to Rs 2 crore to file simplified returns without submitting balance sheets or audits. “This shows taxpayers were right in their filings,” he said.UNDERSTANDING SECTION 44AD RULES Section 44AD is a presumptive taxation scheme for small businesses, provided their cash transactions don’t exceed 5% and turnover is within Rs 3 crore. Taxpayers can declare 6% or 8% of their gross receipts as income without requiring an audit. However, those exceeding Rs 2 crore in turnover must adhere to stricter compliance, including tax audits, said Mihir Tanna of SK Patodia & Associates, while speaking to The Economic Times. While the recall was a relief, it left taxpayers who filed revised ITRs in response to the defective notices in a bind. Experts like Tanna warn that revised ITRs supersede original filings, even if the original notices were erroneous. “Those who didn’t contest the notice may now face processing issues with their revised returns,” he said.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 17, 2024Trending Reel

Headline: Will India's economic growth pick up pace? Nirmala Sitharaman answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman acknowledged that July to September was a challenging period for the economy but called the slowdown a 'temporary blip'.
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that India’s economy will see healthy growth in the coming quarters despite the lower-than-expected GDP numbers for the second quarter. She acknowledged that July to September was a challenging period for the economy but called the slowdown a "temporary blip". India’s GDP growth for the July-September quarter fell sharply to 5.4% from 6.7% in the previous quarter, marking an 18-month low, as per data released by the National Statistics Office (NSO) in November.  Addressing the Lok Sabha on Tuesday, she highlighted the challenges faced during Q2 but maintained a positive outlook for the upcoming quarters. “At 5.4%, the Q2 rate is slower than expected. Q2 of this financial year has been a challenging quarter for India and for most economies around the world,” she said. However, Sitharaman pointed out that India’s GDP growth has averaged 8.3% over the last three years, which she described as a remarkable achievement on a global scale. Sitharaman said, “India has been the fastest-growing major economy in the world, and the credit goes to the people of India and to the leadership.” She reiterated her confidence that the economy will bounce back soon, stating, “The second quarter growth dip is only a temporary blip; the economy will see healthy growth in coming quarters.” The Finance Minister made these remarks while replying to a debate in the Lok Sabha on the first batch of Supplementary Demands for Grants. She also assured the House that India remains the fastest-growing economy in the world, despite global economic pressures. She dismissed concerns about a slowdown in the manufacturing sector, saying there is no broad-based decline and explained that half of the sectors within the overall manufacturing basket remain strong. This indicates that while some sectors may have faced challenges, the manufacturing industry as a whole continues to perform well. Talking about inflation, Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted that it remains better controlled now compared to previous years. She compared the current situation with the inflation levels during the United Progressive Alliance (UPA) government, when it had touched double digits. According to the Finance Minister, retail inflation in April-October 2024-25 stood at 4.8%, which is the lowest level recorded since the Covid pandemic. She said this shows that prices are under control despite global challenges, which include rising oil prices and disruptions in supply chains. The Finance Minister also spoke about the improvement in employment levels in recent years. She said that the unemployment rate in the country has fallen. The rate, which was 6% in 2017-18, has now come down to 3.2%. The Union Minister highlighted this as a sign of the economy’s recovery and growth, as more jobs are being created across various sectors.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 17, 2024Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Dormant account? Here's how to easily reactivate it at SBI, PNB and 2 more banksKeep your bank account active with periodic transactions and KYC updates. Reactivate dormant accounts at HDFC, PNB, SBI, and IDFC FIRST Banks with simple steps.
Content: When a bank account remains inactive for over two years, it is classified as inoperative or dormant. This happens primarily due to prolonged inactivity or failure to update KYC details. The RBI's December 2, 2024 notice highlighted that many customers experience inconveniences, including mismatches in personal details, when attempting to reactivate dormant accounts. With simple steps, however, you can keep your account active or reactivate it without hassle.advertisementTIPS TO PREVENT YOUR ACCOUNT FROM BECOMING INOPERATIVE To keep your account active and avoid unnecessary hassle: Conduct at least one transaction every two years. Set up standing instructions for periodic transfers to or from your account. Link your bank account to UPI apps or mobile wallets for regular payments. Inform your bank in advance if you expect prolonged inactivity and request them to maintain the account’s active status. Here are the steps to Reactivate Accounts in HDFC, SBI, PNB and IDFC FIRST Banks. HDFC Bank Visit your base branch and submit a written application with your signature. Provide self-attested KYC documents for identity and address proof. Initiate any transaction to reactivate the account. Punjab National Bank (PNB) Visit the base branch with a written request and updated KYC documents. Provide Aadhaar details for authentication via biometric e-KYC. Deposit a minimum of â‚¹100 to reactivate the account. You will receive an SMS or email notification once the account is active. State Bank Of India (SBI) Visit any SBI branch with updated KYC documents. Submit a formal activation request. The branch will verify and reactivate the account. IDFC FIRST Bank Visit the bank branch and submit an application for reactivation. For joint accounts, signatures of all account holders are mandatory. Submit KYC documents like address proof, PAN card, and identity proof. Complete one financial transaction to activate the account. Avoid letting your hard-earned money sit idle in an inactive account. An inoperative account can disrupt your financial planning. Simple steps like regular transactions or updating your KYC can keep your account active. Staying proactive is key to smooth and stress-free banking.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 17, 2024
